cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 285 mi WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward – expected to cross the Florida Big Bend this evening, sweep across southeastern Georgia overnight, then skirt the Southeast U.S. coast and move quickly into the western Atlantic toward Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Apalachicola/Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC (superseded by warning)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet, FL northward to South Santee River, SC – includes entire Georgia coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, across northern Florida and southeastern Georgia, then Atlantic coasts of Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force sustained winds of 40–50 mph with higher gusts likely Monday night through early Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding possible (generally less than 3 ft above ground) during high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 8 inches Monday night into Tuesday could cause localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Monday night over coastal southeastern Georgia
